"{
  '''
import asyncio
import re
from playwright.async_api import async_playwright, expect

async def run_tc001():
    """
    Test Case TC001: Successful login to OrangeHRM.
    """
    async with async_playwright() as p:
        browser = await p.chromium.launch(headless=False)
        page = await browser.new_page()
        try:
            # Given the user is on the OrangeHRM login page
            print("Step: Navigating to the OrangeHRM login page...")
            await page.goto("https://opensource-demo.orangehrmlive.com/web/index.php/auth/login")
            
            # When the user enters the username
            print("Step: Entering username...")
            await page.get_by_placeholder("Username").fill("Admin")

            # And the user enters the password
            print("Step: Entering password...")
            await page.get_by_placeholder("Password").fill("admin123")

            # And clicks the login button
            print("Step: Clicking the login button...")
            await page.get_by_role("button", name="Login").click()

            # Then the user should be redirected to the dashboard
            print("Step: Verifying redirection to the dashboard...")
            # Using a regular expression to match the dashboard URL
            await expect(page).to_have_url(re.compile(r".*/dashboard/index"))
            
            # Additional check for a known element on the dashboard
            dashboard_header = page.get_by_role("heading", name="Dashboard")
            await expect(dashboard_header).to_be_visible()
            
            print("TC001: Test Passed - Successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.")

        except Exception as e:
            print(f"TC001: Test Failed - An error occurred: {str(e)}")

        finally:
            await browser.close()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(run_tc001())
'''
